verses.plain: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto my soul.

tokens.t: Save me, O God; for the waters are come in unto
soul.

verses.plain: I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

tokens.t: I sink in deep mire, where
no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.

verses.plain: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

tokens.t: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eyes fail while I wait for my God.

verses.plain: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me, being mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.

tokens.t: They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of mine head: they that would destroy me,
mine enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored
which I took not away.

verses.plain: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

tokens.t: O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.

verses.plain: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.

tokens.t: Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord
of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.

verses.plain: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

tokens.t: Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.

verses.plain: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.

tokens.t: I am become a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my mother’s children.

verses.plain: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

tokens.t: For the zeal of thine house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee are fallen upon me.

verses.plain: When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

tokens.t: When I wept,
my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.

verses.plain: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

tokens.t: I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.

verses.plain: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.

tokens.t: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I
the song of the drunkards.

verses.plain: But as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

tokens.t: But as for me, my prayer
unto thee, O
an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.

verses.plain: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

tokens.t: Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

verses.plain: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

tokens.t: Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

verses.plain: Hear me, O LORD; for thy lovingkindness is good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

tokens.t: Hear me, O
; for thy lovingkindness
good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.

verses.plain: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

tokens.t: And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.

verses.plain: Draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.

tokens.t: Draw nigh unto my soul,
redeem it: deliver me because of mine enemies.

verses.plain: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.

tokens.t: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries
all before thee.

verses.plain: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.

tokens.t: Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked
to take pity, but
none; and for comforters, but I found none.

verses.plain: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

tokens.t: They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

verses.plain: Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.

tokens.t: Let their table become a snare before them: and
for
welfare,
a trap.

verses.plain: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

tokens.t: Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.

verses.plain: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

tokens.t: Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.

verses.plain: Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.

tokens.t: Let their habitation be desolate;
let none dwell in their tents.

verses.plain: For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

tokens.t: For they persecute
whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

verses.plain: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

tokens.t: Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.

verses.plain: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

tokens.t: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.

verses.plain: But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

tokens.t: But I
poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.

verses.plain: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

tokens.t: I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.

verses.plain: This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

tokens.t: also shall please the
better than an ox
bullock that hath horns and hoofs.

verses.plain: The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.

tokens.t: The humble shall see
be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.

verses.plain: For the LORD heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

tokens.t: For the
heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.

verses.plain: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

tokens.t: Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.

verses.plain: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

tokens.t: For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

verses.plain: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

tokens.t: The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.

footnotes.text: deep mire: Heb. the mire of depth
deep waters: Heb. depth of waters
drunkards: Heb. drinkers of strong drink
hear…: Heb. make haste to hear me
to take…: Heb. to lament with me
let none…: Heb. let there not be a dweller
iniquity unto…: or, punishment of iniquity, etc
